active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare Stored XSS with Reflected and DOM-based XSS. Why is Stored XSS particularly insidious in collaborative platforms like forums or social media? Debate using real-world examples like the 2018 British Airways breach where attackers stole customer data via a Stored XSS payload in a chatbot.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate 40 high-quality flashcards on 'Stored XSS Testing' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 007_Input Validation and Injection Flaws > Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) > Stored XSS Testing). Cover all learning objectives, active learning elements, and 4 scaffolding layers evenly (10 cards per 2 layers). Incorporate: - Prior knowledge: Basic XSS, input validation, HTTP. - Research: Stored XSS = persistent script stored server-side; impacts: session hijack, theft; testing: OWASP WSTG-INPV-02 payloads (<script>alert(1)</script>), Burp Suite; mitigations: output encoding, CSP. - Active elements: Discussion comparisons, peer teaching payloads/DVWA, problem-solving exercises. Use this schema exactly: - 15 Basic Q&A - 15 MCQ (4 options, 1 correct) - 10 Cloze Follow distractor protocol strictly. Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'MCQ|Q&A|Cloze', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'objective': 'Remember', 'layer': '1', 'explanation': '...'}] Ensure active recall, spaced repetition friendly: Varied difficulty, no hints on front.
